Package com.xcoder.easyinsta

Class Instagram

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xcoder.easyinsta.Instagram
  • public class Instagram
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an easy implementation of instagram private api in java. This class include various methods to perform instagram operation like direct messages,adding stories,posting photos,scrapping profile data like posts,followers,followings etc.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Rahil khan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Instagram​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Loges in to your instagram account with the provided username and password.
      Instagram​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.String> callback)
      Loges in to your instagram account with the provided username and password and then authenticate using two-factor-authentication.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Instagram

        public Instagram​(@NotNull
                 java.lang.String username,
                 @NotNull
                 java.lang.String password)
        Loges in to your instagram account with the provided username and password. If your account has two-factor authentication, then use second constructor which takes a Callable as an argument.
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the account to log in.
        password - Password of the account associated with this username.

      • Instagram

        public Instagram​(@NotNull
                 java.lang.String username,
                 @NotNull
                 java.lang.String password,
                 @NotNull
                 java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.String> callback)
        Loges in to your instagram account with the provided username and password and then authenticate using two-factor-authentication.
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the account to log in.
        password - Password of the account associated with this username.
        callback - The callback that will be invoked when verification code is sent. You have to return that code.

      • getFollowers

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFollowers​(@NotNull
                                                     java.lang.String username,
                                                     @Nullable
                                                     OnCompleteCallback callback)
        Scraps followers of the account associated with the provided username. Empty list if none found but Never null.
        Parameters:
        callback - Callback that shows the success or failure of the request. This is optional (Nullable)
        username - The username of the account from which you want to scrap.
        Returns:
        The usernames of the followers.
